column1: Takuya Onishi (?? ??, ?nishi Takuya, born 1975) is a Japanese astronaut from JAXA, who was selected in 2009.
Onishi was born in Nerima, Tokyo, Japan.
He completed two years of basic flight training in Bakersfield, California and one year of advanced flight training in Tokyo.
He was promoted to co-pilot of Boeing 767 airplanes in October 2003 and flew both domestic and international routes.
Starting in April 2009, he attended the ISS Astronaut Basic Training domestic program at Tsukuba Space Center in Japan.
Onishi arrived at NASA's Johnson Space Center in Houston, Texas, in August 2009.
Delayed by stormy weather and high seas, the mission began on October 20, 2011.
On the afternoon of October 21, Onishi and his crewmates officially became aquanauts, having spent over 24 hours underwater.

column2: NEEMO 15 ended early on October 26 due to the approach of Hurricane Rina.

column1: Onishi is married and enjoys flying, playing the saxophone, movies and hiking.
This article incorporatespublic domain material from the National Aeronautics and Space Administration document "NASA - Meet the NEEMO 15 Crew" (retrieved on 2011-09-19).
